result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Marie Bremer

records.addlTxt:
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Midwest One Bank in Hudson or Coon Rapids, First Federal Bank Waukesha, C. Scurr or S. Kowalski.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:29 PM Apprs: Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for S. Needham, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: B Harris Defendant Nicole Marie Bremer in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Nicole Marie Bremer.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE confirms address. Atty Chapman states he has an issue with the complaint.  Court schedules this matter for next week for Branch III to review it. Court schedules next hearing. Court orders bond but does not conduct INIT. Adjourned at 2:33 PM.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
